Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2009 06:33PM janscovill4444 wrote: Oh well, I'm what you don't want to hear.  I am PR/ER + and was HR- Did well for five years than got a met nodule in upper R lobe.  Treated it with femara and falsodax.  It would shrink then grow but after 3 years I had RU lobe removed.  Went on chemo just in case because I didn't have cancer anywhere else.  Well 5 months after chemo I got another single nodule in R lower lobe.  I couldn't believe it!!!!!  So in reality, I have had 1 nodule after 5 years then 5 years later another nodule.  So far, I only  have that one nodule left.  I can't really have surgery again for various reasons so I was going to have cyberknife to the nodule but my onc asked me to try megace to see if it will shrink it.  But I know that these hormones only work so long so I may eventually have cyberknife.  I had no lymph node involvement and was Stage 2  Also had a hysterectomy so go figure????  I am 11 years out now but I guess I will always be chasing this disease.  Will have a scan in February so see if the megace is working.  I make sure I always have a whole body pet scan once a year and I am also having a brain MRI in February.  Will always have to watch myself closely.  Good luck to you!  Jan

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2009 09:43PM janscovill4444 wrote: I am on megace and I am a hospice nurse.  When megace is given to increase appetite it is given 800mg twice a day.  I am taking 40mg four times a day.  The dose is much smaller and although it does increase your appetite it is not as bad as the prednisone I took with chemo.  I found that increased my appetite much more.  I have breast cancer for 11 years with mets to the lung for six years.  I had one lesion removed surgically and now have another lesion in right lower lobe whcih cannot be easily removed surgically.  I have had chemo twice and have been on tamoxifen, femara and falsodex.  I too balked when my doctor asked me to use megace because it is not used that often but he claimed he had people doing well on it.  I was going to have cyberknife but my onc. asked me to try megace first.  I started megace in 11/08 and have cat scan this Friday.  Will see if megace it working.  If it isn't I will probably go to the cyberknife--that is if I still only have the one lesion.

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2011 06:32PM janscovill4444 wrote: Well I am on this board almost everyday but I rarely post.  I am a 13 yr survivor, 8 years stage IV,  I have mets to the lung.  Just went for a scan yesterday so I will find out what is up.  I have been on hormones and chemo for the whole 8 years, chemo for 5 yrs.  I have some lasting side effects but not that bad.  No hair, very dry eyes and shortness of breathe which I think is from the avastin.  My mets isn't bad enough to cause SOB and my heart is good.  SOB is my biggest problem which makes me not exersize which makes me out of shape which makes me SOB.. Any hints to break that cycle.  I have been on abraxane and avastin for over a year.  Did Taxol which was a nightmare.  did tykerb and zoleda which was not much better.  I too am sick of chemo but I also want to live so I keep praying for new drugs. There are a lot of long term survivors but think when people are doing well they just don't want to deal with their BC and don't come on these boards.  I need a break from BC too so I am not as involved as a used to be.  Hang in their everyone
